title: Pisaster
text:
Morgan Gray, PhD
Principal and Quantitative Ecologist
Working with ecological data is about more than numbers — it’s about understanding the questions that matter to the people protecting our landscapes and wildlife.
With 15 years of experience in ecological data analysis and time in the nonprofit sector, I understand the challenges conservation organizations face when turning monitoring data into meaningful decisions. That’s where I can help.
I specialize in wildlife monitoring analysis and connectivity mapping, but my work extends to any project involving ecological data. Whether it’s cleaning long-term datasets, building reproducible workflows, designing studies, or creating clear, useful visualizations, I’m here to support your work with practical, reliable analysis.
Clients value my ability to explain results in plain language and offer thoughtful, collaborative guidance. My goal is to make the data side of conservation easier, so you can stay focused on the work you care about most.
Whether you’re looking for help with a specific analysis or ongoing support, I’m here to make sure your data works as hard as you do for conservation.

Education
PhD in Environmental Science, Policy & Management | UC Berkeley 
BA in Integrative Biology | UC Berkeley


Links

title: Translating ecological data into conservation action
text:
We help conservation organizations turn ecological data into clear, meaningful insights. Our expertise in wildlife analysis, landscape mapping, and statistical design makes it easier for you to manage your data, understand your results, and focus on protecting biodiversity.





We help conservation organizations make sense of their ecological data through analysis, mapping, workflow support, and clear communication.
From analyzing camera trap footage and mapping corridors to designing studies and visualizing results, we use ecological data to inform and support conservation. Our approach pairs statistical expertise with a practical understanding of field-based conservation work.
If ecological data is slowing you down, we can help.
Services include:

Wildlife data analysis
Mapping resilient landscapes
Streamlining data workflows
Statistical support & research design
Data visualization
Scientific communication

Our services






Hi, I’m Morgan Gray. With 15 years of experience in ecological data analysis, my work focuses on making complex statistics accessible through clear explanations and practical insights.
Meet Morgan






Have questions about your data or a potential project? Let’s connect.
Get in touch

title: Translating ecological data into conservation action

Have questions about your data or a potential project? Let’s connect.
Get in touch

title: Pisaster
text:
We help conservation organizations make sense of ecological data. While we specialize in wildlife monitoring and connectivity mapping, we work on projects of all kinds — from organizing complex datasets to creating clear, meaningful visualizations. Whether you’re building a new study or making use of existing data, we provide practical, thoughtful support to turn information into insight.


Go beyond raw numbers to understand the story your data is telling. We can help you design effective monitoring programs and analyze the results. Experience working with a range of wildlife data types, including wildlife camera detections; observations in repositories and collections like iNaturalist and GBIF; locations from radio/GPS collars and transect surveys; and genetic markers.

Analyze population trends, habitat use, and species distribution
Design effective monitoring programs
Assess the effectiveness of conservation actions
Create clear reports and figures to share your findings




We use spatial analysis and connectivity modeling to inform conservation planning and landscape management.

Map landscape connectivity and habitat quality
Identify climate-resilient corridors and priority areas
Analyze the impacts of land-use change on biodiversity
Create clear, accessible maps for technical and public audiences




Good decisions start with well-organized data. We help you clean, organize, and manage your datasets, and develop custom workflows to make your work easier, faster, and more reliable.

Clean, organize, and manage ecological datasets
Build reproducible workflows for analysis and reporting
Document metadata and prepare data for repositories
Develop templates, protocols, and training materials
Consult on process design and data management practices




Sound study design and thoughtful analysis lead to stronger, clearer results. We offer expert guidance to help you plan, test, and answer the questions that matter to your work.

Provide study design and statistical consulting
Conduct advanced data analysis for ecological research




Visualize your impact with clear, purposeful visuals that help your audience understand your work. We create designs tailored for both technical and general audiences.

Create insightful figures, maps, and infographics
Build interactive dashboards with Shiny and Quarto
Design large-format maps for meetings, displays, or wayfinding
Produce print-ready materials with clear messaging and design




Share your work in ways that connect with different audiences — from funders to policymakers to community partners. We help you craft materials that are clear and well-designed.

Create automated templates for recurring reports
Develop reports, presentations, and publications tailored to your audience
Ensure designs are optimized for clarity and aligned with your branding

title: Pisaster
text:
We offer comprehensive analysis and consulting for a wide range of ecological data types. We specialize in wildlife monitoring analysis and connectivity mapping. We work on any project involving ecological data, with extensive experience extracting valuable insights from existing datasets. From cleaning datasets to creating automated workflows, from study design to compelling visualizations – we translate ecological data into conservation action.


Go beyond raw numbers to understand the story your data is telling. We can help you design effective monitoring programs and analyze the results. Experience working with a range of wildlife data types, including wildlife camera detections; observations in repositories and collections like iNaturalist and GBIF; locations from radio/GPS collars and transect surveys; and genetic markers.

Analyze population trends, habitat use, and species distribution
Design effective monitoring programs
Assess the effectiveness of conservation interventions
Create compelling reports and figures to communicate your findings




We use spatial analysis and connectivity modeling to inform conservation planning and landscape-scale strategies.

Map habitat quality and landscape connectivity
Identify and prioritize climate-resilient corridors
Analyze land-use change and its impact on biodiversity
Create clear, compelling maps for technical and public audiences




Build a solid foundation for your research with robust data practices. We’ll help you clean, organize, and manage your data efficiently by developing custom, reproducible workflows. Guidance on and documenting existing processes.

Clean, organize, and manage ecological datasets
Build custom, reproducible workflows for analysis and reporting
Document metadata, prepare and submit data to repository
Build templates using data management best practices, write protocols, and conduct trainings
Process design and consulting




Build a solid foundation for your research with robust statistical design. We provide expert guidance on study design and statistical planning to ensure you collect the right data to answer your questions.

Provide study design, statistical consulting, and advanced data analysis




Visualize your impact and communicate your work clearly and effectively to the audiences that matter most, from technical experts to donors and the general public.

Create clear, compelling maps, infographics, and figures that bring your data to life for technical and public audiences
Build web-based, interactive dashboards (Shiny and Quarto)
Large scale maps for wayfinding, permanent display, council meetings
Print-ready (high resolution) brochures, infographics, and maps with optimized design and clear messaging
Use your branding for a consistent vibe




Communicate your work clearly and effectively to the audiences that matter most, from technical experts to donors and the general public. We develop materials tailored for diverse audiences, ensuring your message is heard and understood.

Build web-based and static parameterized templates for recurring reports
Develop reports, presentations, and publications tailored to your audience
Optimized design and clear messaging
Use your branding for a consistent vibe
